income_messages:
From: d**************5@gmail.com
To: CRAWLER
Time: 2023-04-17 19:47:09
SUBJECT: Dr Samuel Ogboku (Chairman/CEO
Dr Samuel Ogboku (Chairman/CEO)
Niger Delta Development Commission(NDDC)
Port Harcourt , Rivers State
www. nddc.gov.ng
Attention,
It is of pleasure contacting you via email. I came across your contact via the World Trade Center (W.T.C.)   African Regional office , without disclosure of my intentions which is personal.
As an authority here in Niger Delta Development Commission, I noticed  three executed contracts which have not been paid for and the contractors who executed these contracts could not be traced or reached  till this moment.Upon my resumption in the office, I called for internal auditing after hand over, I realized  so many  financial lapses involving   huge  contract sum  amounting to Forty Million , Six Hundred and Fourteen Thousand United States of America Dollars (US$40,614,000 Million), Twenty One Million United States of America Dollars (UDS$21 Million ) and Ten Million, Five Hundred  Thousand (US$10,500,000)  respectively.
I further investigated to find out that these  funds were products of over invoicing  from contractors / companies whom  actually and genuinely were awarded  contracts respectively and they  executed the jobs and were duly paid  with Job completion certificates issued ,but my predecessors  could not move the left over  funds  due to
unexpected call for their resignation/ removal from the office ( WRONG TIMING).  Since their resignation,Some of them have  secretly and personally approached me  to cover  these transactions  for them by not disclosing to anyone or leave it in the  NDDC accounts/ records  in order not to implicate them, rather , i should  protect their image and   secure these funds for me and my cabinets as these funds have been there and cannot be declared to the Government , if disclosed, some higher authorities  will find ways to  claim it. I have recently discussed  and agreed with the Executive Project Director, Chief Accountant and  Financial Director  to secure and move this fund outside the country .
However, we further noticed that the  companies used in securing these funds respectively were neither  incorporated  as a legal entity with the Corporate Affairs Commission nor registered with Niger Delta Development Commission as contractors, making it difficult to neither function in business nor authorize for contract payment.
I am fully aware of the activities of some unscrupulous people that are currently going on in our world today which you must have been fully acquainted with unpleasant stories, especially this part. But the truth also remains that the world has not been totally invaded by this group of people hence, people can still do businesses together all over the world and further establish healthier personal and business relationships.
Having explained this , I seek your consent to partner with  us and  secure this fund in your name or company's name. All documents shall be legally provided to suit the purpose . As the Chairman/CEO of Niger Delta Development Commission(NDDC), I cannot risk or gamble with my position. There is no risk whatsoever attached. We will award you with 15% of any secured funds with you and our shares shall  also be invested with you in your country pending when our tenure in the office will elapse .
Kindly get back to me  with your Full name and telephone / mobile number for more details 
if agreed to work with us.Also, I guarantee that this will be executed under legitimate arrangements that will protect you from any breach of the law.
Thank you.
Yours faithfully,
Dr Samuel Ogboku.
From: d**************5@gmail.com
To: go47747@l******s.email
Time: 2023-04-19 02:03:26
SUBJECT: Re: Dr Samuel Ogboku (Chairman/CEO
Dear Travis,
Thanks for accepting to partner with me.
The Funds are processed, approved and gazetted for funding.
We need a registered company, bank account details of the company and other
vital applications to have the payments consolidated and approved in one
company name.
Upon approval by the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC), an
application to the paying bank will be sought for which advice shall be
given.
Also, we could arrange a payment system through an overseas payment centre
where the payment could be made within 5 working days upon approval is
sought by the NDDC.
We shall also furnish you all the previous documents attached to the funds
and the new documents domiciled in any company you provided.
For the immediate process, we need the following from you:
1. YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS.
2. TELEPHONE NUMBER
3. COMPANY NAME AND ADDRESS WITH THE EVIDENCE OF REGISTRATION.
4. BANKING DETAILS DOMICILED IN THE COMPANY'S NAME AS PROVIDED.
5. ANY FORM OF IDENTIFICATION ( INTERNATIONAL PASSPORT OR DRIVERS LICENSE)
With the above information, we can apply for claims of funds with evidence
on ground which are:
i, Award Notification in the name of the  previous company .
ii, Irrevocable Corporate Purchase Order.
iii,Signed contract between the NDDC and the previous    company.
Note that upon application, we shall then approve the payment in the name
of the company/ persons to be provided by you.
Kindly call me if you need more details.
Thank you,
Yours sincerely,
Dr Samuel Ogbuku.
MD/CEO, Niger Delta Development Commission.
outbound_messages:
From: go47747@l******s.email
To: d**************5@gmail.com
Time: 2023-04-17 19:47:16
SUBJECT: Re: Dr Samuel Ogboku (Chairman/CEO
Dear Dr Samuel Ogboku,
Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the opportunity to discuss this matter with you. However, I must say that I am a bit skeptical about the proposal you have presented. Can you provide more information about the contracts that were executed and the companies involved? Also, I would like to know more about the legalities of moving the funds outside the country. 
I am interested in learning more about this opportunity, but I would like to proceed with caution. Please let me know if you can provide more information.
Best wishes,
Travis
From: go47747@l******s.email
To: d**************5@gmail.com
Time: 2023-04-19 04:45:16
SUBJECT: Re: Dr Samuel Ogboku (Chairman/CEO
Dear Dr Samuel Ogbuku,
Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the opportunity to partner with you. I understand that the funds are processed, approved and gazetted for funding. However, before I provide any personal or company information, could you please provide me with more details about the partnership and the project? What is the project about? What is the role of my company in the project? What are the terms and conditions of the partnership? 
I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Best wishes,
Travis
